message: Sam, you mentioned that you created a Fluid app for Convore. I can't seem to get it to log me in. When I go through the login process, it always ends up in the default browser (Chrome) where I'm already logged in. Thoughts?

Fluid, for those of you just joining us, is an OSX app that creates a site specific browser for a particular website. It's useful for things like Convore or Pandora when you don't want them to just exist as a tab in your browser.

Oh, I figured it out. There's a setting in Preferences > Advanced. It was only allowing convore.com/kynetx inside Fluid; everything else went to the system browser. Changing that pattern or selecting "Allow browsing to any URL" solved the problem. :-)
Um. not many. It just worked for me the first time. I am logging in with a convore login, not a social login, so that may make a difference.
Sweet. I'm going to re-title the topic to reflect a fix.
It would be great if the simulated growl notifications in Convore's web app would detect Fluid and redirect to the system growl.
